Datastructures.Statistics

Class Statistic

  • java.lang.Object
    • Datastructures.Statistics.Statistic
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataStatistics, ProblemStatistics

    public class Statistic
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the superclass of all Statistics classes. It provides some top-level parameters and some static methods for accumulating and printing statistics. The accumulate methods use reflection to collect statistics values from the subclasses. Created by ohlbach on 11.10.2018.

      • extractStatistic

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> extractStatistic(boolean zeros)
        This method extracts the statistics fields from the Statistic object and collects them in an array.
        Parameters:
        zeros - if true then zero-values are also included
        Returns:
        an array with entries: [name,value]

      • statisticToString

        public static java.lang.String statisticToString(java.lang.String id,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> values)
        This method turns the values extracted by the extract-method into a formatted string.
        Parameters:
        id - the statistic's id
        values - an array with tuples [name,value]
        Returns:
        a formatted string

      • statisticToCSV

        public static java.lang.String statisticToCSV(java.lang.String id,
                                              java.lang.String separator,
                                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> values)
        This method turns the values extracted by the extract-method into a csv-printable string.
        Parameters:
        id - the statistic's id
        separator - to separate the items (e.g. ',')
        values - an array with tuples [name,value]
        Returns:
        a csv-printable string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean zeros)
        This method generates a formatted string with the statistics information
        Parameters:
        zeros - if true then all fields with zero-value are also included.
        Returns:
        a formatted string with the statistics values

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method generates a formatted string with the statistics information. zero-values are not included.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a formatted string with the statistics values

      • combineSameStatistics

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> combineSameStatistics(Statistic[] statistics,
                                                                            boolean zeros)
        combines several statistics of the same type.
        Parameters:
        statistics - an array of statistics of the same type
        zeros - if true then the 0-values are also included.
        Returns:
        a list of tuples [name, value_1,...,value_n, accumulated values, average value]

      • combineDifferentStatistics

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> combineDifferentStatistics(Statistic[] statistics,
                                                                                 boolean zeros)
        combines several statistics of different type.
        Parameters:
        statistics - of the same type
        zeros - if true then the 0-values are also included.
        Returns:
        a list of tuples [name, value_1,...,value_n, accumulated values, average value]

      • statisticToString

        public static java.lang.String statisticToString(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> statistics)
        This method turns the statistics information, collected by a combine-method into a printable string.
        Parameters:
        statistics - A list of entries: [name, value_1,...,value_n, sum, average]
        Returns:
        the formatted string

      • statisticToCSV

        public static java.lang.String statisticToCSV(java.lang.String separator,
                                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> statistics)
        This method turns the statistics information collected by the combine-methods into a string which can be printed to a csv-file
        Parameters:
        statistics - A list of entries: [name, value_1,...,value_n, sum, average]
        separator - for the csv-entries
        Returns:
        a csv-printable string.

      • descriptions

        public static java.lang.String descriptions()
        This method collects the descriptions of all statistics fields and puts them into a formatted string
        Returns:
        a formatted string with the descriptions of all statistic fields.
